contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Sailboat Specifications |name = |image = |imagesize = |alt = |caption = |class_symbol = |class_image = Javelin1.png |class_imagealt = J with arrow through it |class_imagesize = |crew = 2 |type = |design = |construction = |rig = |keel = |trapeze = |loa = 14 ft |loh = |lwl = |beam = 5 ft 8 in |draft = 3 ft 10 in |hull = 475 lbs |mastheight = |mainsailandjib = 125 ft<sup>2</sup> |sailarea = |mainsail = |jib = |spinnaker = |d-pn = 111.3 |rya-pn = |phrf = |year = 1960 |designer = Uffa Fox |location = |role = |updated = 5 October 2010 |olympic = }} {{Two other uses|the sailing dinghy primarily raced in the USA and Japan|the sailing dinghy primarily raced in New Zealand and Australia|Javelin dinghy (Australasia)|the sailing dinghy primarily raced in Europe|Javelin dinghy (Europe)}}{{Other uses of|Javelin}} The '''Javelin''' is a 14-foot dinghy designed by [[Uffa Fox]] in 1960 and built by the O'Day company until the mid-1980s. The boat is a comfortable daysailer. Over 5000 were produced in the United States and they are still being built in Japan. The Javelin sails off a [[Portsmouth Yardstick|D-PN]] of 111.3<ref name="UScb">{{cite web |url=http://offshore.ussailing.org/Portsmouth_Yardstick/Current_Tables/Centerboard_Classes.htm |title=Centerboard Classes |publisher=US Sailing |accessdate=31 July 2012}}</ref> ==References== <references /> ==External links== *[http://www.odayjavelin.com/ O'Day Javelin] {{Sailing-stub}} {{Sailing Dinghies and Skiffs}} [[Category:Dinghies]]
